diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute pancreatitis, gallstone/sludge or ETOH related; Macrocytic anemia; CKD II
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute onset of severe epigastric abdominal pain, elevated lipase level of 4680, and imaging findings of gallbladder distention and CBD dilation. These findings are consistent with acute pancreatitis, likely related to alcohol use or gallstone/sludge without evidence of cholecystitis.
